page.title: 09MAGELAKE MEADOW, UFFCULME
page.content: { Magelake Meadow}was given to the Village of Uffculme by Thomas Brice in 1943. It is now held in trust by the{Parish Council}and administered by a Management Committe under the auspices of the Charity Commissioners. During 1982-4 the field was ploughed, levelled and reseeded. There are several drainage systems underground dating back to Victorian times. These were renovated and reinstated as far as possible by volunteer labour. An artificial 'Nottinghamshire Wicket' was installed at this time.There are also two full-sized football pitches. The total cost of this work was over Â£6 000 and about half of this was obtained in grants from Devon County Council and the Sports Council. This field is now used throughout the year by Uffculme Cricket Team and Culm Uni- ted Football Teams.Drainage suspect.
